intro: Cochlearia sagittata, commonly known as the arrowhead candytuft, is a flowering plant native to the Arctic and subarctic regions. It is characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, arrow-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, white, star-shaped flowers. The plant is typically found in rocky and coastal habitats, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other flowering plants with similar floral structures. Cochlearia sagittata is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and hardy nature.
